algorithm_technique: Sliding window approach using a hash map to keep track of fruit types and their counts within the window.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum number of fruits you can pick with two baskets, each holding only one type of fruit.
problem_summary_technical: Employs a sliding window where the window expands to the right and shrinks from the left to maintain at most two distinct fruit types.
key_insights: The problem is equivalent to finding the longest subarray with at most two distinct elements.
A sliding window with a frequency map (dictionary) is ideal for this.
When the window violates the condition (more than two fruit types), shrink the window from the left.
